intro: Mentzelia micrantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Mentzelia micrantha has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in open grasslands and desert environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for native pollinators.
